snippet: The assault on Paris has thrust national security to the heart of the presidential race, forcing candidates to scramble to address terrorism concerns.
abstract: Political Memo; concerns about national security in wake of Paris attacks have slammed to forefront of debate among presidential hopefuls in both parties; analysts speculate that issue may disrupt America's fascination with unconventional and inexperienced candidates in favor of more vetted politicians in time of crisis; some candidates speak to how they would lead nation through fight against Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: The assault on Paris has thrust national security to the heart of the presidential race, forcing candidates to scramble to address terrorism concerns.

headline.main: In Presidential Campaign, It’s Now Terrorism, Not Taxes
headline.print_headline: In Presidential Campaign, It’s Now Terrorism, Not Taxes

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
